title: Bill Bruford's Earthworks - Earthworks (1987) [EAC-FLAC]
description:
Bill Bruford's Earthworks - Earthworks (1987) 
             EAC rip (secure mode) | FLAC (tracks)+CUE+LOG -> 256 Mb
                      Full Artwork @ 300 dpi (jpg) -> 15 Mb


Drummer Bill Bruford made a name for himself in the '70s as a rock & roller of a progressive bent. In the '80s he formed the rather extraordinary jazz/fusion band that became Earthworks â€“ Bruford, saxophonist Iain Ballamy, keyboard and brass virtuoso Django Bates, and bassist Mick Hutton. This was their first album; an interesting one it was, though a later, live recording of the band presented some of the same material in a more highly developed state, rendering this original somewhat irrelevant.

Bruford is a stiff-wristed player â€“ not a particularly subtle percussionist, though his compositional skills are apparently of a high quality (most of the tunes are co-written with other band members, so it's hard to know how much credit to give Bruford). The best thing about this band is its refreshing ingenuousness; they make intelligent, sophisticated instrumental pop music that doesn't pander in the least. This is their art, and a fine art it is.

Mick Hutton - acoustic bass

Dave Stewart - co-producer (with Bruford), and credited with "samples, keyboard bass, very occasional additional keyboards"
